title: Create a new favorite list
name: CreateFavorite
description: Create a new favorite list.

permission.name: IsAuthenticated
permission.title: Authenticated full access.
permission.description: Grants all HTTP methods to authenticated users.

Parameter.description: Favorite list activity. true is active, false is inactive

examples.title: Request example
examples.content:
{
    "accesskey": "00f74dc12bdd0c35",
    "name": "name",
    "user": "user",
    "products": ["0p4n6ql29b3zxitw", "obyvxs25e713d0ki"],
    "active": "True"
}

Created 201.description: Favorite list activity. true is active, false is inactive

examples.title: Result example
examples.content:
{
     "id": "ag2ehs2z75m3fb0n",
     "active": true,
     "name": "name",
     "user": "identifier",
     "products": [
         "p3qy8fn2j71legxk",
         "ibo1eh4nv62s5fr8",
         "xukmapdx479h0v2q"
     ],
     "account": "014c4e0783188022"
 }

examples.title: curl
examples.content:
# <user>, <pword> and <ak> must be replaced by valid authentication details
# <name>, <user>, <product-id> and <secret-key> must be replaced with valid values
curl -u <user>:<pword> -X POST \
https://api.tracdelight.com/v1/favorites?accesskey=<ak> \
-H "X-Secret-Key: <secret-key>" \
-d "name=<name>" \
-d "user=<user>" \
-d "products=[<product-id>]"

examples.title: javascript
python
examples.content:
# <user>, <pword> and <ak> must be replaced by valid authentication details
# <name>, <user>, <product-id> and <secret-key> must be replaced with valid values
>>> import requests
>>> url = "https://api.tracdelight.com/v1/favorites/accesskey={}".format("<ak>")
>>> user, pword = "<user>", "<pword>"
>>> payload = {"user": "<user>", "name": "<name>", "products": ["<product-id>"]}
>>> headers = {"X-Secret-Key": "<secret-key>"}
>>> requests.post(
>>>     url, auth=(user, pword), data=payload, headers=headers
>>> )

examples.title: NoAuthenticationCredentials
examples.content: {"detail": "Authentication credentials were not provided."}

examples.title: HTTPMethodNotAllowed
examples.content: {"detail": "Method \"PATCH\" not allowed."}

examples.title: BadRequest
examples.content: {"detail": "JSON parse error - No JSON object could be decoded"}

title: Delete a favorite list
name: DeleteFavorite
description: Delete a favorite list. The favorite-list-id is a unique 16 character hash.

permission.name: IsAuthenticated
permission.title: Authenticated full access.
permission.description: Grants all HTTP methods to authenticated users.

examples.title: Request example
examples.content: {"accesskey": "00f74dc12bdd0c35"}

examples.title: curl
examples.content:
# <user>, <pword> and <ak> must be replaced by valid authentication details
# <favorite-list-id> must be replaced with a valid favorite list id
# <secret-key> must be replaced with valid value
curl -u <user>:<pword> -X DELETE \
https://api.tracdelight.com/v1/favorites/<favorite-list-id>?accesskey=<ak> \
-H "X-Secret-Key: <secret-key>"

examples.title: javascript
python
examples.content:
# <user>, <pword> and <ak> must be replaced by valid authentication details
# <favorite-list-id> must be replaced with a valid favorite list id
# <secret-key> must be replaced with valid value
>>> import requests
>>> url = "https://api.tracdelight.com/v1/favorites/{}?accesskey={}".format(
>>>     "<favorite-list-id>", "<ak>"
>>> )
>>> user, pword = "<user>", "<pword>"
>>> headers = {"X-Secret-Key": "<secret-key>"}
>>> requests.delete(url, auth=(user, pword), headers=headers)

title: Delete a product
name: DeleteProduct
description: Delete a product. The product-id is a unique 16 character hash.

permission.name: IsAuthenticated
permission.title: Authenticated full access.
permission.description: Grants all HTTP methods to authenticated users.

permission.name: IsAdminOrReadOnly
permission.title: Authenticated access for safe HTTP methods
permission.description: Grants all safe (GET, OPTION, HEAD) HTTP methods to authenticated users.

Parameter.description: locale parameter is always necessary. Locale of the product

examples.title: Basic request example
curl
examples.content:
# <user>, <pword> and <ak> must be replaced by valid authentication details
# <product-id> must be replaced with a valid product id
# <lc> must be replaced by a valid value
curl -u <user>:<pword> -X DELETE \
https://api.tracdelight.com/v1/products/<product-id>?locale=<lc>&accesskey=<ak>

examples.title: javascript
python
examples.content:
# <user>, <pword> and <ak> must be replaced by valid authentication details
# <product-id> must be replaced with a valid product id
# <lc> must be replaced by a valid value
>>> import requests
>>> url = "https://api.tracdelight.com/v1/products/{}?locale={}&accesskey={}".format(
>>>     "<product-id>", "<lc>", "<ak>"
>>> )
>>> user, pword = "<user>", "<pword>"
>>> requests.delete(url, auth=(user, pword))

examples.title: NoAuthenticationCredentials

title: Aggregate for all tools of an account
name: GetToolTypeAggregated
description:
Retrieve aggregated statistical data of tool <tool-type>. Aggregated data is data for every tool of an account without combining results.

  • how many times the tools were called
  • how many times the tools were viewed (visible in viewport)
  • how many times every product was clicked on
  • how many times every product was viewed

permission.name: IsAuthenticated
permission.title: Authenticated full access.
permission.description: Grants all HTTP methods to authenticated users.

permission.name: IsAdminOrReadOnly
permission.title: Authenticated access for safe HTTP methods
permission.description: Grants all safe (GET, OPTION, HEAD) HTTP methods to authenticated users.

Parameter.description: publisher_id is a parameter which can be used instead of the accesskey for session/basic authentication
from parameter specifies the starting date for statistical data. Defaults to 7 days ago
to parameter specifies the ending date for statistical data. Defaults to today
all parameter specifies if inactive tools should also be included in response

title: Combine for all tools of an account
name: GetToolTypeCombined
description:
Retrieve combined statistical data of tool <tool-type>. Combined data is the sum of all statistical data for every tool of an account. Statistical data corresponds to:

  • how many times the tools were called
  • how many times the tools were viewed (visible in viewport)
  • how many times every product was clicked on
  • how many times every product was viewed

from parameter specifies the starting date for statistical data. Defaults to 7 days ago
to parameter specifies the ending date for statistical data. Defaults to today
all parameter specifies if inactive tools should also be included in response
